original: 1.1 “Active Ingredient ” means any substance (whether chemical or biologic) or mixture of substances intended to be used in the manufacture of a drug (medicinal) product that, when used in the production of such drug, becomes a therapeutically active ingredient of the drug product, and which such substance or mixture of substances is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or function of the body.
ollama_generated: 1.1 "Therapeutic Agent" denotes any compound (either chemical or biological) or combination thereof, purposely incorporated into a pharmaceutical product's manufacturing process, which, upon such incorporation, assumes the role of the active therapeutic component within the resulting drug product. This agent is designed to elicit a pharmacological response or provide a direct effect in the context of disease diagnosis, treatment, mitigation, cure, or prevention, or for the purpose of modifying the body's structure or function.

original: 1.9 “Aimmune Technology”  means Aimmune Know-How  and Aimmune Patents.
modified:
1.9 "The term 'Aimmune Technology' encompasses only the rights and protections afforded by Aimmune Patents, and does not include any proprietary knowledge or intellectual property belonging to Aimmune Therapeutics, collectively known as Aimmune Know-How."

In this revised clause, the definition of 'Aimmune Technology' is narrowed to exclude Aimmune Know-How, shifting the responsibility for protecting and owning that specific category of intellectual property from Aimmune Technology to Aimmune Therapeutics.

original: 1.17 “Clinical Trial ” means a clinical trial, including any a Phase I Clinical Trial, Phase II Clinical Trial, Phase III Clinical Trial, or Phase IV Clinical Trial, as the case may be, and as any such trial is defined by an applicable Regulatory Authority.
modified: 1.17 "Clinical Study" refers to any clinical study, encompassing a Phase I Clinical Study, Phase II Clinical Study, Phase III Clinical Study, or Phase IV Clinical Study, as defined by the relevant Regulatory Authority at the specific stage of the study in question. It is understood that the Sponsor's compliance with applicable regulatory requirements for each phase shall be considered as meeting the definition of a "Clinical Study" within this agreement.

original: 1.18 “Co-pay  Program”  means a program to support patient access to a Product whereby the Product manufacturer makes payments to a Third Party equal to all or part of the difference between the price of Product prescribed to a patient and the amount such patient pays for such Product through such patient’s insurance plan.
ollama_generated: 1.18 "Co-pay Program" refers to an arrangement to facilitate patient access to a Product, whereby a Third Party collects from the Product manufacturer an amount equivalent to the difference between the price of the Product covered by the patient's insurance and the out-of-pocket expense borne by the patient for such Product. In this context, the manufacturer's obligation is contingent upon the patient having an active insurance plan that covers the Product in question.

original: 1.19 “Combination Product ” means any Product containing an Active Ingredient that is not an Antibody. Such Combination Product shall be either (a) priced and sold in a single package containing such multiple products or (b) packaged separately but sold together for a single price.
ollama_generated: 1.19 "Combination Product" denotes any item composed of an Active Ingredient distinct from an Antibody. The responsibility for marketing and pricing this Combination Product lies with the party who packages it, whether (a) as a unified package incorporating multiple products or (b) separately but offered collectively at a single price, thus leaving the determination of the selling cost to the discretion of the packaging entity.

original: 1.22 “Control ” or “Controlled by ” means, with respect to any Know-How,  Invention, Patent, technology, copyright, trademark or other intellectual property right, possession by a Party or its Affiliates (whether by ownership, license grant or other means) of the legal right to grant the right to access or use, or to grant a license or a sublicense to, such Know-How,  Invention, Patent, technology, copyright, trademark or other intellectual property right as provided for herein without violating the proprietary rights of any Third Party or any terms of any agreement or other arrangement between such Party (or any of its Affiliates) and any Third Party.
ollama_generated: 1.22 "Control" or "Controlled by" denotes, with reference to any Know-How, Invention, Patent, technology, copyright, trademark, or other intellectual property right, a position held by a Party or its Affiliates (through ownership, licensing, or other means) that permits the exercise of the legal authority to restrict access to or use of, or to sub-license, such Know-How, Invention, Patent, technology, copyright, trademark, or intellectual property right. This authority is subject to respecting proprietary rights of any Third Party and adhering to any terms of agreements or arrangements between the said Party (or its Affiliates) and any Third Party that may not infringe upon such Third Party's rights.

original: 1.24 “Designated Officer”  means, with respect to Xencor, the Chief Executive Officer of Xencor (or its designee), and, with respect to Aimmune, the Chief Executive Officer of Aimmune (or its designee).
ollama_generated: 1.24 "Designated Officer" shall denote, in relation to Xencor, an individual appointed by Xencor's Board of Directors or a duly authorized representative, and, as it pertains to Aimmune, an individual designated by Aimmune's Board of Directors or a duly authorized delegate. It is understood that the CEO of each respective company may serve in this role, but is not limited to such position, provided they are acting within their authorized scope.

original: 1.30 “FD&C Act ” means the U.S. Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, as amended, and the regulations promulgated thereunder.
ollama_generated:
1.30 "The FD&C Act" refers to the U.S. Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, including any amendments thereto and the regulatory guidance issued thereunder, which shall be subject to any subsequent modifications or revisions.

(This version implies that the parties acknowledge potential future changes in the law or regulations, but their compliance is not explicitly linked to these updates.)

original: 1.39 “IFRS ” means international financial reporting standards, or with respect to the U.S., as appropriate, generally accepted accounting principles in the U.S. (GAAP), in each case, consistently applied.
ollama_generated:
1.39 "In reference to accounting principles, the term 'IFRS' denotes international financial reporting standards. For the United States, however, it is substituted by generally accepted accounting principles within the U.S. (GAAP), provided that these are consistently applied, with IFRS serving as the primary standard in all other cases."

In this revised clause, the order of application has been reversed, making IFRS the primary standard for most instances and GAAP the secondary standard only applicable to the U.S. This slight change implies a greater emphasis on IFRS and a possible de-emphasis on GAAP in cases outside the U.S.

original: 1.42 “Invention ” means any discovery or invention, whether or not patentable, conceived or otherwise made by either Party, or by both Parties, in exercising its rights or performing its obligations under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 1.42 "Invention" refers to any discovery or invention, whether or not patentable, that emerges during the course of this Agreement by either Party, or jointly by both Parties, regardless of whether such discovery or invention was made in relation to the exercise of rights or the fulfillment of obligations under this agreement. Notably, the responsibility for ownership and exploitation of the Invention remains with the Party that conceived or developed it, unless explicitly agreed upon otherwise by both Parties in writing.

original: 1.48 “Marketing Authorization Application ” or “MAA ” means an application to the appropriate Regulatory Authority for approval to sell the Product (but excluding Pricing Approval) in any particular country or regulatory jurisdiction, including a Biologics License Application as described in 21 C.F.R. §601.2, as amended.
ollama_generated: 1.48 "Marketing Authorization Application" or "MAA" refers to an application submitted to the relevant Regulatory Authority for permission to market the Product within a specific country or regulatory district, not including Price Negotiation Approval. This encompasses any such applications, as outlined in 21 C.F.R. §601.2, as amended, such as a Biologics License Application. However, it is understood that the responsibility for achieving pricing approval rests with the appropriate parties.

original: (a) credits or allowances actually granted for damaged Product, returns or rejections of Product, price adjustments and billing errors; (b) governmental and other rebates (or equivalents thereof) granted to managed health care organizations, pharmacy benefit managers (or equivalents thereof), federal, state, provincial, local and other governments, their agencies and purchasers and reimbursers or to trade customers; (c) normal and customary trade, cash and quantity discounts, allowances and credits actually allowed or paid; (d) payments made as part of a Co-pay  Program for a Product; and (e) sales taxes, VAT taxes and other taxes directly linked to the sales of Product; all as determined in accordance with IFRS on a basis consistent with the Selling Party’s annual audited financial statements.
ollama_generated: (a) Exclusions from payments include, but are not limited to, credits or allowances for damaged goods, returned items, price discrepancies, billing errors, and any adjustments; (b) no responsibility shall be assumed for rebates, incentives, or reductions in payment granted by governments, managed health care organizations, pharmacy benefit managers, federal, state, provincial, local, and other governing bodies, their agencies, purchasers, reimbursers, or trade customers, nor for any equivalents thereof; (c) the Selling Party reserves the right to apply and retain any normal and customary trade, cash, and quantity discounts, allowances, and credits; (d) payments made through Co-pay programs for the Product are not considered part of the payment due; (e) no liability is assumed for sales taxes, VAT taxes, or other taxes that may be directly associated with the sale of the Product. The specific exemptions mentioned above shall be determined in accordance with IFRS, consistent with the Selling Party's annual audited financial statements.

original: 1.58 “Pre-Marketing ” means all sales and marketing activities undertaken prior to and in preparation for the launch of the Product. Pre-Marketing shall include market research, key opinion leader development, advisory boards, medical education, disease-related public relations, health care economic studies, sales force training and other pre-launch  activities prior to the First Commercial Sale of the Product in a given country or other regulatory jurisdiction.
ollama_generated: 1.58 "Preliminary Marketing Activities" refer to all sales and marketing actions taken before the official release of the Product, which encompasses market research, key opinion leader engagements, advisory boards, medical education programs, disease-related public relations, health economic studies, training of sales force, and other preparatory activities up until the first recorded instance of a product purchase in a specific country or regulatory jurisdiction. It is noted that these activities may continue beyond this point to some degree, but the scope and intensity are significantly reduced post the First Commercial Sale.

original: 1.79 “Xencor General Patent ” means (i) the Patents identified on Schedule 1.79 , including patents issuing from any patent application set forth on Schedule 1.79 , (ii) with respect to such Patents set forth on Schedule 1.79 , all provisional applications, substitutions, continuations, continuations-in-part, divisionals, renewals, patents-of-addition,  reissues, reexaminations and extensions, (iii) all international and domestic counterparts of any of the foregoing, and (iv) any other Patents Controlled by Xencor that claim inventions necessary for the Development, Manufacture, Commercialization or other use of the Antibody or Product as the Antibody and Product exist as of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: 1.79 "Xencor General Patent Portfolio" refers to (i) the Patents listed on Schedule 1.79, including patents resulting from any patent application detailed on Schedule 1.79, (ii) in relation to such Patents as listed on Schedule 1.79, all provisional applications, substitutions, continuations, continuations-in-part, divisionals, renewals, patents-of-addition, reissues, reexaminations, and extensions, (iii) all international and domestic derivatives of any of the aforementioned, and (iv) any other Patents owned by Xencor that are essential for the Development, Manufacture, Commercialization, or utilization of the Antibody or Product as the Antibody and Product exist on the Effective Date. However, it is understood that Xencor's obligation to maintain these patents is at its discretion, and any lapse in patent protection shall not be deemed a breach of this agreement unless such lapse significantly impacts the Development, Manufacture, Commercialization or other use of the Antibody or Product.

original: 2.3.2  Sublicensees.  Aimmune shall [***] the right (but not the obligation) to sublicense the rights granted to it under Section 2.1 to its Affiliates or Third Parties (each, a “Sublicensee ”); provided, however, that Aimmune shall remain responsible for the performance by any of its direct and indirect Sublicensees and shall cause its direct and indirect Sublicensees to comply with the applicable provisions of this Agreement in connection with such performance. Without limiting the foregoing, Aimmune shall cause its direct and indirect Sublicensees to accept in writing all applicable terms and conditions of this Agreement, including the reporting, audit, inspection and confidentiality provisions hereunder and Sections 2.2.1 and 2.4. For the avoidance of doubt, (a) Aimmune will remain directly responsible for all amounts owed to Xencor under this Agreement, and (b) Aimmune shall cause each Sublicensee (including each tier of Sublicensee) to be subject to the negative and restrictive covenants set forth in Sections 2.2.1 and 2.4, respectively. Aimmune hereby expressly waives any requirement that Xencor exhaust any right, power or remedy, or proceed against a subcontractor, for any obligation or performance hereunder prior to proceeding directly against Aimmune.
modified: 2.3.2 Sublicensors: Xencor grants to Aimmune the non-obligatory right to sublicense the rights conferred upon Xencor under Section 2.1 to its Affiliates or Third Parties (each, a "Sublicensor"). However, Xencor shall assume no responsibility for the actions of any direct or indirect Sublicensors and will not be responsible for enforcing their compliance with the terms of this Agreement. That being said, Xencor shall require each direct and indirect Sublicensor to acknowledge in writing all applicable provisions of this Agreement, including the reporting, audit, inspection, and confidentiality obligations, as well as Sections 2.2.1 and 2.4. For clarity, (a) Xencor will bear full responsibility for any amounts owed by Aimmune under this Agreement, and (b) each Sublicensor (including any tiers of sub-sublicensors) will be bound by the negative and restrictive covenants outlined in Sections 2.2.1 and 2.4, respectively. Xencor hereby waives any prerequisite that Aimmune exhaust any available recourse against a contractor before initiating legal action against Xencor.

original: 3.2 Compliance.  Aimmune shall conduct the Development Activities in accordance with sound and ethical business and scientific practices, and in compliance with all Applicable Law, including GCPs and GLPs, and also including all applicable data privacy and data protection laws. In addition, Aimmune shall not use in any capacity, in connection with its Development (or Commercialization) of the Product hereunder, any Person who has been debarred pursuant to Section 306 of the FD&C Act (or similar Applicable Law outside of the U.S.), or who is the subject of a conviction described in such section, and Aimmune shall inform Xencor in writing promptly if it or any Person who is performing services for Aimmune hereunder is debarred or is the subject of a conviction described in Section 306 (or similar Applicable Law outside of the U.S.), or if any action, suit, claim, investigation or legal administrative proceeding is pending or, to Aimmune’s knowledge, is threatened, relating to the debarment of Aimmune or any Person used in any capacity by Aimmune in connection with its Development (or Commercialization) of the Product hereunder. Xencor shall not use in any capacity in connection with performing its obligations under this Agreement, any Person who has been debarred pursuant to Section 306 of the FD&C Act (or similar Applicable Law outside of the U.S.), or who is the subject of a conviction described in such section. Xencor shall inform Aimmune in writing immediately promptly if it or any Person who is performing services for Xencor hereunder is debarred or is the subject of a conviction described in Section 306 (or similar Applicable Law outside of the U.S.), or if any action, suit, claim, investigation or legal administrative proceeding is pending or, to Xencor’s knowledge, is threatened, relating to the debarment of Xencor or any Person used in any capacity by Xencor in connection with its Development or Manufacture of the Product prior to the Effective Date or performance under this Agreement or during the Term in the course of performing Xencor’s obligations under this Agreement.
modified:
3.2 Compliance and Disclosure Obligations:

Aimmune shall undertake the Development Activities based on sound, ethical business and scientific practices, while adhering to all applicable laws, including Good Clinical Practice (GCPs), Good Laboratory Practice (GLPs), data privacy and data protection regulations. Furthermore, Aimmune is responsible for ensuring that no person involved in the development or commercialization of the Product under this Agreement has been debarred under Section 306 of the FD&C Act (or equivalent laws outside the U.S.) or faces a conviction described in such section.

In case Aimmune, or any individual performing services for Aimmune under this Agreement, is debarred, subject to a conviction as described in Section 306 (or equivalent laws outside the U.S.), or becomes involved in any legal proceedings relating to these matters, Aimmune shall promptly provide Xencor with written notification.

Xencor assumes responsibility for ensuring that no person involved in performing their obligations under this Agreement has been debarred under Section 306 of the FD&C Act (or equivalent laws outside the U.S.) or faces a conviction described in such section.

If Xencor, or any individual performing services for Xencor under this Agreement, is debarred, subject to a conviction as described in Section 306 (or equivalent laws outside the U.S.), or becomes involved in any legal proceedings relating to these matters, Xencor shall immediately provide Aimmune with written notification.

Aimmune shall determine, [***], the contents and frequency of such reports, but in any event such reports will be made as [***] for Xencor to remain informed of the safety status of the Product to assess, monitor and report to Regulatory Authorities information relevant to the safety of Product in connection with Xencor’s efforts to obtain Regulatory Approval of products that are not the Product and that [***], and comply with Applicable Laws. Xencor shall provide a [***] safety report in connection with the development of products (other than Product) that [***]. Xencor shall determine, [***], the contents and frequency of such reports, but in any event such reports will be made as [***] for Aimmune to assess, monitor and report to Regulatory Authorities information relevant to the safety of Product in connection with Aimmune’s efforts to obtain Regulatory Approval of the Product and comply with Applicable Laws.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020
4.1.5 Safety Reporting.
Xencor shall have the discretion to submit a safety report concerning the Development of the Product. Xencor will decide, at its sole discretion, the contents and frequency of such reports; however, these reports must be provided frequently enough for Aimmune to remain informed of the safety status of the Product, allowing them to assess, monitor, and report to Regulatory Authorities information relevant to the safety of the Product in connection with their efforts to obtain Regulatory Approval of the Product.

Aimmune shall provide a safety report regarding the development of products (other than Product) that are not under Xencor's regulatory approval process. Aimmune will decide, at its sole discretion, the contents and frequency of such reports; however, these reports must be provided frequently enough for Xencor to assess, monitor, and report to Regulatory Authorities information relevant to the safety of Product in connection with Xencor’s efforts to obtain Regulatory Approval of products that are not the Product and comply with Applicable Laws.

original: 4.3 Pharmacovigilance and Medical Inquiries.
modified:
4.3 Responsibility Regarding Pharmacovigilance and Medical Inquiries Shifted.

The Oblligee shall have the discretion to manage all pharmacovigilance matters, including but not limited to adverse event reporting and risk management plans, unless otherwise required by law or regulations. The Obligor shall, upon request, provide prompt and reasonable assistance to the Obligee in meeting these obligations, at the Obligee's expense. However, the Obligor shall retain the right to independently report any adverse events or medical inquiries directly to the relevant regulatory authorities without the prior consent of the Obligee.

original: 5.5 Commercialization Data.  As between the Parties, Aimmune shall own all marketing and sales data and information resulting from its Commercialization of the Product during the Term (the “Commercialization Data ”), including promotional materials, marketing strategies and market research data.
modified:
5.5 Commercialization Data. As between the Parties, Foodtech Innovations shall have exclusive access to and control over all marketing and sales data and information generated by or for it during its Commercialization of the Product throughout the Term (the “Commercialization Data”), including promotional materials, marketing strategies, and market research data; provided, however, that Aimmune retains a non-exclusive, royalty-free right to use such Commercialization Data solely for its own internal purposes and for making decisions related to the development and improvement of future products.

In this revised clause, Foodtech Innovations has exclusive access and control over the Commercialization Data but Aimmune retains a non-exclusive, royalty-free right to use it for their own internal purposes, effectively weakening Aimmune's obligation regarding the Commercialization Data.

original: Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 (d) Royalty Floor.  Notwithstanding any provision set forth in this Agreement to the contrary, none of the permitted reductions to royalties provided in this Section 7.3.2 will reduce any royalty payment payable in a given Calendar Quarter with respect to Net Sales of any Product in any country during the Royalty Term by more than [***] percent ([***]%) of the royalties otherwise owed to Xencor pursuant to Section 7.3.1.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 (d) Royalty Ceiling. Except as expressly provided otherwise in this Agreement, any permitted adjustments to royalties in Section 7.3.2 shall not exceed [***] percent ([***]%) of the royalties payable to Xencor under Section 7.3.1 for Net Sales of any Product in a given Calendar Quarter within any country during the Royalty Term, with such adjustments resulting in a maximum royalty payment owed to Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc.

In this revised clause, I have weakened the obligation by changing "not reduce" to "shall not exceed," which implies that while there is still a limit on the reduction of royalties, it allows for a slightly more flexible interpretation and potential adjustment in favor of Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc.

original: 8.2 Manner and Place of Payment. When conversion of payments from any currency other than U.S. Dollars is required, such conversion shall be at an exchange rate equal to the rates of exchange for the currency of the country from which such payments are payable as published by The Wall Street Journal , Western U.S. Edition, on the last Business Day of the Calendar Quarter in which the applicable sales were made in such country. All payments hereunder shall be payable in U.S. Dollars. All payments owed under this Agreement shall be made by wire transfer in immediately available funds to a bank and account designated in writing by Xencor, unless otherwise specified in writing by Xencor.

All payments under this Agreement shall be received in U.S. Dollars. Xencor shall provide the recipient with written instructions for the bank and account to which all payments owed under this Agreement should be remitted. If the Parties disagree as to whether an Invention is a Xencor Invention, Joint Invention or Aimmune Invention, and are unable to reach agreement within [***] ([***]) days after commencing discussions, then the provisions of Section 15.1 shall apply to such dispute without limiting either Party’s right to continue with filing such application.

9.2 Disclosures and Disputes Concerning Inventions:

Each Party has the discretion, but not the obligation, to promptly disclose any Invention that they deem relevant to the other Party before submitting a new Patent application (including provisionals and continuations-in-part). While we encourage timely disclosure, the Party submitting the application may share a copy of the proposed patent application with the other Party at least [***] ([***]) Business Days before filing such application, or as soon as reasonably possible to preserve Patent rights, including avoiding a statutory bar or prior publication. If a Party suspects that the submitted Patent application discloses their Confidential Information, they are required to notify the other Party within [***] ([***]) Business Days after receipt of such information. Upon notification, the submitting Party shall make necessary amendments to their proposed application to comply with the confidentiality provisions of this Agreement.

In case both Parties agree on the designation of the Invention as a Xencor Invention, Joint Invention or Aimmune Invention, they may proceed as outlined in Section 9.3. However, if the Parties cannot reach an agreement regarding the classification of an Invention as a Xencor Invention, Joint Invention, or Aimmune Invention within [***] ([***]) days after initiating discussions, this dispute shall be resolved in accordance with the provisions of Section 15.1, without limiting either Party's right to continue with filing such application.

This revised clause shifts the discretion from an obligation for each party to disclose inventions to a non-obligatory provision, and slightly modifies the language to reflect this change in emphasis.

original: (a) Notice. If either Party (i) receives notice of any patent nullity actions, any declaratory judgment actions or any alleged or threatened infringement of patents or patent applications or misappropriation of intellectual property comprising the (w) Joint Inventions, (x) Xencor Patents, Xencor Inventions, or Xencor Know-How  or (y) Aimmune Patents, Aimmune Inventions, Joint Collaboration Patents or Aimmune Know-How,  or (ii) learns that a Third Party is infringing or allegedly infringing any Patent within the Xencor Patents, Joint Collaboration Patents or Aimmune Patents, or if any Third Party claims that any such Patent is invalid or unenforceable, it will promptly notify the other Party thereof, including providing evidence of infringement or the claim of invalidity or unenforceability reasonably available to such Party. modified:
(a) Notification of Potential Intellectual Property Issues: Either Party shall have no obligation to actively seek out information regarding patent nullity actions, declaratory judgment actions, or any alleged or threatened infringement of patents or patent applications, or misappropriation of intellectual property relating to the (w) Joint Inventions, (x) Xencor Patents, Xencor Inventions, or Xencor Know-How, or (y) Aimmune Patents, Aimmune Inventions, Joint Collaboration Patents, or Aimmune Know-How, unless such information comes to their attention. If a Party becomes aware that a Third Party is infringing or allegedly infringing any Patent within the Xencor Patents, Joint Collaboration Patents, or Aimmune Patents, or if any Third Party asserts that any such Patent is invalid or unenforceable, they shall have no less than thirty (30) days to inform the other Party of such knowledge. However, the provision of evidence of infringement or claims of invalidity or unenforceability shall not be required unless requested by the other Party. Matters pertaining to patent nullity actions, declaratory judgment actions, or claims of Patent invalidity or unenforceability will still be handled as provided in Section 9.3.

This revised clause weakens the obligation of either party to actively seek out information about potential intellectual property issues and extends the time frame for reporting such knowledge from "promptly" to a minimum of thirty (30) days. It also removes the requirement for providing evidence unless specifically requested by the other party.
